p: Avian influenza (AI) is a respiratory disease. Its severity depends on many factors including host age, virus strain, and secondary infections. The causative agent is prevalent worldwide. Influenza A virus belongs to the family Orthomyxoviridae and the genus Influenzavirus A, and is characterized by a segmented, single-stranded, negative-sense RNA genome. This genus is subdivided into 17 hemagglutinin (HA) and 9 neuraminidase (NA) subtypes. AI virus infects domestic poultry, mammals and humans, and is thought to have originated in migratory wild birds [1].
